result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont C Koker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CORRECTED 04-11-2016:  Severity class corrected for Ct. 1.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or educational pursuits.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Upon release, engage in Racine Vocational Ministry and Fatherhood Initiative Program.  No contact with victim.  No contact with gangs or gang members.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.
Court costs are waived; DNA surcharge remains due and owing.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Lamont C Koker in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Lamont C Koker in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.  Letters received re: sentencing.  950 compliance.  No statement by victim or victims family.  The state presents it's sentencing argument.  State recommends 15 to 18 years WPS plus 10 yrs ES.  Defendants father, JK, speaks on his sons behalf.   Defense presents it's sentencing argument.  Defense recommends 4 yrs WPS and 6 yrs. ES.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  Judge presents it's sentence.

BTC:  10 yrs wps and 10 yrs ES
